main

Class FIODataBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.FIODataBlock

  • public class FIODataBlock
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a Data block.

    Helper used for handling Data blocks objects. More information available here.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    David Ervideira, Theo FIDRY (theo.fidry@gmail.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FIODataBlock()
      Instantiate an empty data block (which contains no data blocks).
      FIODataBlock(net.sf.json.JSONObject dataBlock)
      Instantiate an instance which contains the data points present in the JSON.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Empties this instance.
      boolean equals(FIOAlerts alerts)
      Compares this instance to another alert list to determine if they are equals.

      Get a data point from the this data block.

      Get the list of available data points.
      java.lang.String getIcon()
      Get the icon string for the given data block.
      java.lang.String getSummary()
      Get the summary of this instance.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Check if this instance has any alert available.
      static boolean isValid(net.sf.json.JSONObject data)
      Check if the JSON given has the required information for being processed as a list of data points.
      int size()
      Get the number of data points available.
      boolean update(net.sf.json.JSONObject dataBlock)
      Updates this instance with the given JSON file.

                                throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Get a data point from the this data block.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the data point
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getDataPoints

        public final FIODataPoint[] getDataPoints()
        Get the list of available data points.

        If the is no data point is available, an empty array will be returned.
        Returns:
        list of available data points | empty

      • size

        public final int size()
        Get the number of data points available.
        Returns:
        number of data points

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(net.sf.json.JSONObject data)
        Check if the JSON given has the required information for being processed as a list of data points.

        To see what is a valid JSON for a data point check FIODataPoint.isValid.
        Parameters:
        data - JSON checked | null
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise

      • update

        public boolean update(net.sf.json.JSONObject dataBlock)
        Updates this instance with the given JSON file.

        If the JSON passed is invalid, this instance will be emptied.
        Parameters:
        dataBlock - JSON source | null
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Empties this instance.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Check if this instance has any alert available.
        Returns:
        true if not empty, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(FIOAlerts alerts)
        Compares this instance to another alert list to determine if they are equals.

        Two alert lists are considered as equals if they contains the same list of alerts. The order doesn't matter.
        To see in which conditions two alerts are equals, check FIOAlert.equals.
        Parameters:
        alerts - alert list to which compare this instance | null
        Returns:
        true if equal, false otherwise
